items.title: Magnitude 6 earthquake in eastern Afghanistan leaves at least 800 dead
items.standfirst: Rescue efforts hampered by steep terrain after shallow quake that was felt more than 100 miles away in KabulAfghanistan earthquake – latest updatesA powerful earthquake that hit eastern Afghanistan has left more than 800 people dead and injured about 2,500, according to Taliban officials.The magnitude 6 earthquake hit four provinces in eastern Afghanistan around midnight on Sunday, with the rugged, mountainous region of Kunar the worst affected, triggering landslides and flooding. items.content: More than 800 people have been killed and at least 2,800 others injured after an earthquake hit eastern Afghanistan, according to Taliban state officials.

items.title: Earthquake devastates eastern Afghanistan, killing hundreds and destroying villages
items.standfirst: The 6.0 magnitude quake late Sunday hit a series of towns in the province of Kunar, near the city of Jalalabad in neighboring Nangahar province, causing extensive damage.
items.content: The 6.0 magnitude quake late Sunday hit a series of towns in the province of Kunar, near the city of Jalalabad in neighboring Nangahar province, causing extensive damage.(Image credit: AP)

items.title: Rescuers try to reach quake-hit areas in eastern Afghanistan
items.standfirst: Rescuers on Monday struggled to reach remote areas struck by a 6.0 magnitude earthquake in eastern Afghanistan, says FRANCE 24's Shahzain Wahlah,reporting from Islamabad in neighbouring Pakistan.
items.content: Rescuers on Monday struggled to reach remote areas struck by a 6.0 magnitude earthquake in eastern Afghanistan, says FRANCE 24's Shahzain Wahlah,reporting from Islamabad in neighbouring Pakistan.

items.title: Earthquake in eastern Afghanistan kills hundreds, destroys villages
items.standfirst: A 6.0 magnitude earthquake centred near the bustling eastern Afghan city of Jalalabad late Sunday killed more than 800 people and injured around 2,500, according to the Taliban government's chief spokesman. The quake razed villages in the eastern provinces of Kunar and Nangarhar, according to local authorities.
items.content: A 6.0 magnitude earthquake centred near the bustling eastern Afghan city of Jalalabad late Sunday killed more than 800 people and injured around 2,500, according to the Taliban government's chief spokesman. The quake razed villages in the eastern provinces of Kunar and Nangarhar, according to local authorities.

items.content: Officials say at least 800 people killed and 2,500 injured after the magnitude 6 earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan.

items.title: At least 800 killed as 6.0-magnitude earthquake rocks Afghanistan

items.content: At least 800 people have been killed and over 1,000 have been injured in Afghanistan after a 6.0-magnitude earthquake hit the country, Taliban officials said Monday.

items.title: At least 600 killed as powerful earthquake rocks eastern Afghanistan

items.content: Toll likely to rise, with significant damage reported across mountainous provinces of Kunar and Nangahar, sources say.

ai_summary: A 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan late Sunday, causing extensive damage.
The quake hit towns in Kunar province, near Jalalabad in neighboring Nangahar province.
Over 800 people were killed, and at least 2,800 others were injured in the disaster.
Rescue efforts are hampered by the mountainous terrain and the remote location of villages.
Taliban authorities reported the earthquake's impact and the ongoing rescue operations.

clusters.title: Putin and Modi seen holding hands ahead of meeting with Xi
clusters.neutral_headline: China's Xi Jinping Calls for New Global Order at Summit
bullet_summary: Members of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) should cooperate further in economics and security to move away from the Western-led world order, China's President Xi Jinping has said
Reported by NBC World, Reuters Top News, France24 and others

items.title: Putin and Modi seen holding hands ahead of meeting with Xi
items.standfirst: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi were seen walking hand in hand ahead of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit in Tianjin, China. The leaders’ closeness could be seen as a rebuke to President Trump, who imposed an additional 25% tariff on India after it purchased Russian oil, bringing the total tariff on the country to 50%.
items.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi were seen walking hand in hand ahead of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit in Tianjin, China. The leaders’ closeness could be seen as a rebuke to President Trump, who imposed an additional 25% tariff on India after it purchased Russian oil, bringing the total tariff on the country to 50%.

items.title: Asian leaders attend China'a SCO summit
items.standfirst: The Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit began on Sunday in the northern port city of Tianjin, just days ahead of a major military parade in Beijing commemorating the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II. On Monday, Presidents Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin used the gathering of Eurasian leaders to deliver pointed criticism of the West, in a summit designed to spotlight Beijing’s central role in regional affairs. FRANCE 24’s Patrick Fok reports on the key issues at play.
items.content: The Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit began on Sunday in the northern port city of Tianjin, just days ahead of a major military parade in Beijing commemorating the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II. On Monday, Presidents Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin used the gathering of Eurasian leaders to deliver pointed criticism of the West, in a summit designed to spotlight Beijing’s central role in regional affairs. FRANCE 24’s Patrick Fok reports on the key issues at play.

items.title: China's Xi unveils new global governance plan
items.standfirst: Chinese President Xi Jinping unveiled the Global Governance Initiative during the Shanghai Cooperation Organization Plus 2025 meeting in Tianjin on Monday. In his address, Xi emphasized the importance...
items.content: Chinese President Xi Jinping unveiled the Global Governance Initiative during the Shanghai Cooperation Organization Plus 2025 meeting in Tianjin on Monday. In his address, Xi emphasized the importance...

items.title: Xi Jinping criticises ‘bullying behaviour’ and Putin blames west for Ukraine war at Shanghai summit
items.standfirst: China’s leader urges attendees to oppose ‘cold war mentality’ while Russian president claims Ukraine war was ‘provoked by the west’Xi Jinping has criticised the “bullying behaviour” of other countries while Vladimir Putin has blamed the west for his war on Ukraine, on the second day of a major summit in China which seeks to challenge western-led multilateral blocs.The Shanghai Cooperation Summit (SCO) began in the city of Tianjin on Sunday, with Xi welcoming dozens of leaders from Eurasian member states and other partner and observer countries, including Putin, and Indian prime minister Narendra Modi. Continue reading...
items.content: China’s leader urges attendees to oppose ‘cold war mentality’ while Russian president claims Ukraine war was ‘provoked by the west’Xi Jinping has criticised the “bullying behaviour” of other countries while Vladimir Putin has blamed the west for his war on Ukraine, on the second day of a major summit in China which seeks to challenge western-led multilateral blocs.The Shanghai Cooperation Summit (SCO) began in the city of Tianjin on Sunday, with Xi welcoming dozens of leaders from Eurasian member states and other partner and observer countries, including Putin, and Indian prime minister Narendra Modi. Continue reading...

items.title: Xi slams 'bullying', Putin defends Ukraine invasion at China’s SCO summit
items.standfirst: Opening the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit in Tianjin on Monday, Chinese President Xi Jinping blasted the "bullying behaviour" of certain countries in a veiled reference to US President Donald Trump's tariff war. In his speech to the gathering of Eurasian leaders, Russian President Vladimir Putin blamed the West for triggering the Ukraine war.
items.content: Opening the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit in Tianjin on Monday, Chinese President Xi Jinping blasted the "bullying behaviour" of certain countries in a veiled reference to US President Donald Trump's tariff war. In his speech to the gathering of Eurasian leaders, Russian President Vladimir Putin blamed the West for triggering the Ukraine war.

items.title: Putin, Modi and Erdoğan among leaders in China for talks with Xi
items.standfirst: Chinese president hosts bilateral meetings on sidelines of Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in TianjinXi Jinping and Vladimir Putin have met on the sidelines of a showpiece summit in China that seeks to challenge US-led, western-dominated blocs and is being attended by the leaders of more than two dozen nations.The Chinese and Russian leaders, who are closely allied under what they have termed a “limitless” partnership, discussed Putin’s recent meeting with Donald Trump, according to a Kremlin official, who gave no further details. Continue reading...
items.content: Chinese president hosts bilateral meetings on sidelines of Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in TianjinXi Jinping and Vladimir Putin have met on the sidelines of a showpiece summit in China that seeks to challenge US-led, western-dominated blocs and is being attended by the leaders of more than two dozen nations.The Chinese and Russian leaders, who are closely allied under what they have termed a “limitless” partnership, discussed Putin’s recent meeting with Donald Trump, according to a Kremlin official, who gave no further details. Continue reading...

items.title: Vladimir Putin meets Xi Jinping arrives in China for security summit – Ukraine war live
items.standfirst: Russian president and his Chinese counterpart shake hands as more than 20 world leaders attend Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in TianjinFollowing a meeting with Ukraine’s top general, Oleksandr Syrsky, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that his country’s forces are planning new strikes deep into Russia.In a post on X, the Ukrainian leader wrote:We analysed in detail the situation in the Zaporizhzhia direction and the enemy’s intentions. Also the situation in the border areas of the Sumy and Kharkiv regions.We will continue our active operations in exactly the way needed for Ukraine’s defence. The forces and resources are prepared. New deep strikes have also been planned. Continue reading...
items.content: Russian president and his Chinese counterpart shake hands as more than 20 world leaders attend Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in TianjinFollowing a meeting with Ukraine’s top general, Oleksandr Syrsky, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that his country’s forces are planning new strikes deep into Russia.In a post on X, the Ukrainian leader wrote:We analysed in detail the situation in the Zaporizhzhia direction and the enemy’s intentions. Also the situation in the border areas of the Sumy and Kharkiv regions.We will continue our active operations in exactly the way needed for Ukraine’s defence. The forces and resources are prepared. New deep strikes have also been planned. Continue reading...

items.title: Putin, Modi and other world leaders in China for summit
items.standfirst: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi are among the 20 world leaders attending a regional security summit in China.
items.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi are among the 20 world leaders attending a regional security summit in China.

ai_summary: Xi Jinping advocated for increased economic and security cooperation among SCO members.
The goal is to move away from the current Western-led global order, according to Xi.
Vladimir Putin blamed the West for the war in Ukraine during the summit.
The summit in Tianjin, China, highlighted Beijing's central role in regional affairs.
Leaders discussed global governance and criticized "bullying behavior" by other nations.

clusters.title: Iran-backed Houthis raid UN offices in Yemen, detain 11 employees
clusters.neutral_headline: Houthis Detain UN Personnel in Yemen, Sparking Condemnation
bullet_summary: Iran-backed Houthis on Sunday raided offices of the United Nations’ food, health and children's agencies in Yemen’s capital, detaining several UN employees, officials said
Yemen's Houthi rebels have raided United Nations offices and detained several people, officials have said

items.title: Iran-backed Houthis raid UN offices in Yemen, detain 11 employees
items.standfirst: Iran-backed Houthis on Sunday raided offices of the United Nations’ food, health and children's agencies in Yemen’s capital, detaining several UN employees, officials said. The rebels tightened security across Sanaa following the Israeli killing of their prime minister and several Cabinet members. FRANCE 24's Sarah Anderson has more from New York.
items.content: Iran-backed Houthis on Sunday raided offices of the United Nations’ food, health and children's agencies in Yemen’s capital, detaining several UN employees, officials said. The rebels tightened security across Sanaa following the Israeli killing of their prime minister and several Cabinet members. FRANCE 24's Sarah Anderson has more from New York.

items.title: Houthis detain at least 11 UN workers in raids on two agencies in Sana’a
items.standfirst: UN condemns ‘arbitrary detentions’ by Iran-backed group at World Food Programme and Unicef offices in YemenThe Iranian-backed Houthis raided offices of the UN’s food, health and children’s agencies in Yemen’s capital, detaining at least 11 employees, as the rebels tightened security across Sana’a after the Israeli killing of their prime minister and several cabinet members.The UN envoy for Yemen, Hans Grundberg, said on Sunday evening: “I strongly condemn the new wave of arbitrary detentions of UN personnel today in Sana’a and Hodeidah … as well as the forced entry into UN premises and seizure of UN property. At least 11 UN personnel were detained.” Continue reading...
items.content: UN condemns ‘arbitrary detentions’ by Iran-backed group at World Food Programme and Unicef offices in YemenThe Iranian-backed Houthis raided offices of the UN’s food, health and children’s agencies in Yemen’s capital, detaining at least 11 employees, as the rebels tightened security across Sana’a after the Israeli killing of their prime minister and several cabinet members.The UN envoy for Yemen, Hans Grundberg, said on Sunday evening: “I strongly condemn the new wave of arbitrary detentions of UN personnel today in Sana’a and Hodeidah … as well as the forced entry into UN premises and seizure of UN property. At least 11 UN personnel were detained.” Continue reading...

items.title: Houthi rebels detain at least 11 UN personnel, envoy to Yemen says
items.standfirst: The United Nations envoy to Yemen, Hans Grundberg, condemned the “arbitrary detentions” of at least 11 UN staff by Houthi rebels on Sunday and demanded that they be “immediately and unconditionally” released. Those arrested included seven World Food Programme employees and three UNICEF workers, a security source in Sanaa told AFP.
items.content: The United Nations envoy to Yemen, Hans Grundberg, condemned the “arbitrary detentions” of at least 11 UN staff by Houthi rebels on Sunday and demanded that they be “immediately and unconditionally” released. Those arrested included seven World Food Programme employees and three UNICEF workers, a security source in Sanaa told AFP.

ai_summary: Iran-backed Houthis raided UN offices in Yemen, detaining at least eleven employees.

The Houthis tightened security across Sanaa after an Israeli killing.
Detained personnel included World Food Programme and UNICEF workers.

items.title: Suspect arrested in fatal shooting of Ukrainian politician, Zelensky says
items.standfirst: Ukrainian officials have arrested a suspect in the shooting death of former parliamentary speaker and prominent Maidan protest leader Andriy Parubiy, President Volodymyr Zelensky announced early Monday. While details of the suspect's identity were not revealed, the head of the Ukrainian police said Kyiv suspects Russian involvement.
items.content: Ukrainian officials have arrested a suspect in the shooting death of former parliamentary speaker and prominent Maidan protest leader Andriy Parubiy, President Volodymyr Zelensky announced early Monday. While details of the suspect's identity were not revealed, the head of the Ukrainian police said Kyiv suspects Russian involvement.

items.standfirst: New York City’s ex-mayor, 81, in ‘good spirits’ after being treated for fractured thoracic vertebrae, cuts and bruisesNew York City’s former mayor Rudy Giuliani has been hospitalized after getting injured in a car wreck in New Hampshire over the weekend.On Sunday, Giuliani’s head of security, Michael Ragusa, released a statement, saying that the 81-year old was involved in a motor vehicle accident on Saturday evening. According to Ragusa, prior to the incident, Giuliani was flagged down by a woman who was the victim of a domestic violence incident. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Royal Mail reported a profit for the first time in three years.

The postal service made a pre-tax profit of £194 million.
Parcel volumes increased, contributing to the financial turnaround.
The company is working to improve its financial performance.

clusters.title: Senior Hamas figure Abu Obeida killed in Gaza, says Israel

items.title: Senior Hamas figure Abu Obeida killed in Gaza, says Israel
items.standfirst: Israel claims to have killed Abu Obeida, the spokesperson for Hamas’ armed wing, in an airstrike on Gaza over the weekend. He is the latest high-ranking figure targeted as part of Israel’s ongoing efforts to dismantle Hamas’ military infrastructure. Charlotte Lam reports with more details.
